get.summary: Provides a list of TiDB Cloud Serverless clusters in a project.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Optional. The maximum number of clusters to return.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Optional. The page token from the previous response for pagination.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional. The filter expression to filter clusters.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Optional. The order by expression for sorting clusters.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description:
The number of individual resources to skip before starting to return results.
If the skip value causes the cursor to move past the end of the collection,
the response will be 200 OK with an empty result set and no next_page_token.

post.summary: Creates a new TiDB Serverless cluster.

parameters.name: cluster
parameters.description: Required. The cluster to be created.

get.summary: Retrieves details of a specific TiDB Cloud Serverless cluster.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: Required. The ID of the cluster to be retrieved.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
Optional. The level of detail to return for the cluster.

 - BASIC: Only basic information about the cluster is returned.
 - FULL: All details about the cluster are returned.

delete.summary: Deletes a specific TiDB Cloud Serverless cluster.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: Required. The ID of the cluster to be deleted.

patch.summary: Partially updates a specific TiDB Cloud Serverless cluster.

parameters.name: cluster.clusterId
parameters.description: Output_only. The unique ID of the cluster.

put.summary: Changes the root password of a specific TiDB Cloud Serverless cluster.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: Required. The ID of the cluster for which the password is to be changed.

get.summary: Provides a list of available regions for TiDB Cloud Serverless clusters.

post.summary:
Creates new TiDB Cloud Serverless clusters in batch.
The operation is atomic: it fails for all clusters or succeeds for all clusters (no partial success).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Message for requesting to create a batch of TiDB Cloud Serverless clusters.

get.summary:
Retrieves details of TiDB Cloud Serverless clusters in batch.
The operation is atomic: it fails for all clusters or succeeds for all clusters (no partial success).
For situations requiring partial failures, ListClusters method should be used.

parameters.name: clusterIds
parameters.description: A maximum of 1000 clusters can be get in a batch.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
Optional. The level of detail to return for the cluster.

 - BASIC: Only basic information about the cluster is returned.
 - FULL: All details about the cluster are returned.

ClusterClusterPlan.title:
- STARTER: alicloud starter plan
 - ESSENTIAL: alicloud essential plan

ClusterHighAvailabilityType.title:
- ZONAL: High availability within a single zone
 - REGIONAL: High availability across multiple zones within a region

monthly.description: Optional. Maximum monthly spending limit in USD cents.

requestUnit.description: Output_only. The Request Units used in this month.

rowBasedStorage.description: Output_only. The storage used on row-based storage in bytes.

columnarStorage.description: Output_only. The storage used on column-based storage in bytes.

ClusterUsage.description: Message for usage statistics of a cluster.

host.description: Output_only. The hostname of the private endpoint.

port.description: Output_only. The port of the private endpoint.

EndpointsPrivate.description: Message for private endpoint to securely connect to the cluster.

host.description: Output_only. The hostname of the public endpoint.

port.description: Output_only. The port of the public endpoint.

disabled.description: Optional. Whether the public endpoint is disabled.

authorizedNetworks.title: The list of networks that are allowed to connect to the cluster

EndpointsPublic.description: Message for public endpoint to connect to the cluster.

serviceName.description: Output_only. The AWS service name for private access.

availabilityZone.description: Output_only. The availability zones that the service is available in.

serviceAttachmentName.description: Output_only. The target GCP service attachment name for private access.

PrivateGCP.description: Message for GCP Private Service information.

password.description: Required. The new root password for the cluster.

ServerlessServiceChangeRootPasswordBody.description: Message for requesting to change the root password of a TiDB Cloud Serverless cluster.

commonv1beta1ClusterState.description:
Enum of possible states of a cluster.

 - CREATING: Cluster is being created.
 - DELETING: Cluster is being deleted.
 - ACTIVE: Cluster is active for use.
 - RESTORING: Cluster data is being restored.
 - MAINTENANCE: Cluster is under maintenance.
 - DELETED: Cluster has been deleted.
 - INACTIVE: Cluster is not active, but not being deleted.
 - UPGRADING: Cluster is being updated.
Only for Dedicated Cluster.
 - IMPORTING: Cluster is being imported.
Only for Dedicated Cluster.
 - MODIFYING: Cluster is being modified.
Only for Dedicated Cluster.
 - PAUSING: Cluster is being paused.
Only for Dedicated Cluster.
 - PAUSED: Cluster is paused.
Only for Dedicated Cluster.
 - RESUMING: Cluster is resuming.
Only for Dedicated Cluster.

name.title:
The unique name of the region.
Format: regions/{region_id}

cloudProvider.description: The cloud provider for the region.

displayName.description: User-friendly display name of the region.

provider.description:
Optional provider name for the region.
Only used for serverless cluster.
Deprecated.

commonv1beta1Region.description: A representation of a region for deploying TiDB clusters.

code.description:
The status code, which should be an enum value of
[google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized
by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

googlerpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

serverlessv1beta1ClusterView.description:
Enum for the different types of detail view to be returned for a TiDB Cloud Serverless cluster.

 - BASIC: Only basic information about the cluster is returned.
 - FULL: All details about the cluster are returned.

name.description: Output_only. The unique name of the cluster.

clusterId.description: Output_only. The unique ID of the cluster.

displayName.description: Required. User friendly display name of the cluster.

region.description: Required. Region where the cluster will be created.

spendingLimit.description: Optional. The spending limit for the cluster.

automatedBackupPolicy.description: Optional. Automated backup policy to set on the cluster.

endpoints.description: Optional. The endpoints for connecting to the cluster.

encryptionConfig.description: Optional. Encryption settings for the cluster.

version.description: Output_only. The TiDB version of the cluster.

createdBy.description: Output_only. The email of the creator of the cluster.

userPrefix.description: Output_only. The unique prefix in SQL user name.

state.description: Output_only. The current state of the cluster.

usage.description: Output_only. Usage details of the cluster.

labels.description:
Optional. The labels for the cluster.
tidb.cloud/organization. The label for the cluster organization id.
tidb.cloud/project. The label for the cluster project id.

annotations.description:
OUTPUT_ONLY. The annotations for the cluster.
tidb.cloud/has-set-password. The annotation for whether the cluster has set password.
tidb.cloud/available-features. The annotation for the available features of the cluster.

createTime.description: Output_only. Timestamp when the cluster was created.

updateTime.description: Output_only. Timestamp when the cluster was last updated.

auditLogConfig.description: Optional. The audit log configuration for the cluster.

clusterPlan.description: Output_only. The plan of the cluster.

autoScaling.description: Optional. The auto scaling config for the cluster.

unredacted.description: Optional. Whether unredacted the audit log.

retentionDays.description: OUTPUT_ONLY. Number of days to retain automated backups.

enhancedEncryptionEnabled.description: Optional. Whether enhanced encryption for cluster data is enabled.

private.description: Output_only. Private endpoint to securely connect to the cluster.
